title: Bloom's Taxonomy-Based Legal Research and Practical Competency Assessment Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic legal terminology and experience in analyzing practical documents
context.additional_context: Education for current practitioners targeting practical problem-solving in digital environments

learning_goals: Perform legal research processes step-by-step according to Bloom’s Taxonomy’s six levels (Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create).
Objectively measure legal document analysis and practical application skills through formative assessments (feedback during the process) and summative assessments (evaluation of final outputs).
Systematically conduct the entire process—problem definition, solution, and report writing—by studying real-world corporate legal cases using the PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
